title: Michael Basman, Chess Master Known for ‘Bad’ Openings, Dies at 76
description: His opening repertoire was often successful. But it should have carried a label: “Do not try these at home (or at least not in important competitions).”
dc:creator: Dylan Loeb McClain
media:description: Michael Basman at the 1967-68 Hastings chess tournament in England. He used an unusual repertoire of opening moves because he wanted to avoid the well-traveled roads that most other top players followed.
